header_summary:
Peter Todd and Antoine Poinsot engaged in a detailed examination of the "SCRIPT_ERR_SIG_PUSHONLY" error within Bitcoin's script execution rules, underscoring the technical complexities of transaction validation and the collaborative nature of the Bitcoin development community to enhance system robustness. Their discussion, accessible for further insights on [Peter Todd's website](https://petertodd.org), highlights the ongoing efforts to understand and refine Bitcoin's operational mechanics ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/87360fbe-30dd-4e18-acbf-7416c47ebc61n@googlegroups.com/T/#meaa5e86ed68223742ad9980bed6deee7fdf168e7)).

Yuval Kogman's analysis on the role of Wabisabi coordinators in the coinjoin.kruw.io ecosystem, based on data from [liquisabi.com](https://liquisabi.com/), delves into the nuances of privacy, censorship, and financial operations within Bitcoin transactions. This discussion raises important questions about the transparency and representation of coordinators' roles, emphasizing the need for clarity in the cryptocurrency community ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALiT-Zoj5fd2zK3moMLo+S-L8xTyB2qgCNU_ocm_6mce832JcQ@mail.gmail.com/T/#m37007aa47b6ef547c536f4b53a1d630d0984d0c0)).

Agustin Cruz proposes a proactive measure against potential quantum computing threats to Bitcoin, suggesting a mandatory migration to safeguard both active and lost coin supplies. This strategy aims to preemptively mitigate vulnerabilities, emphasizing the importance of decisive action to maintain Bitcoin's security and trust foundations. Cruz's proposal calls for community readiness and smooth transition plans to counteract the prospective quantum computing challenges ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAJDmzYzUAzoCj3da-3M_ast0_+Qxf3_J1OXWf88B2D-R70pPrg@mail.gmail.com/T/#m87ff7212c78ab0144ba98eb1f58b1ba13a602021)).

The [bcap project](https://github.com/bitcoin-cap/bcap) and the new Bitcoin Inquisition 28.1 release, integrating features from [Bitcoin Core 28.1](https://bitcoincore.org/en/releases/28.1/), represent forward strides in consensus changes and technological advancements within the Bitcoin network. These initiatives underscore the importance of community agreement on updates and introduce enhanced transaction capabilities, marking continuous efforts to evolve Bitcoin's framework and address emerging challenges ([source 1](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bitcoin-forking-guide/1451), [source 2](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bitcoin-inquisition-28-1/1445)).

recent_posts.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine Poinsot inquired about the "SCRIPT_ERR_SIG_PUSHONLY" error on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List.
- The discussion revolves around Bitcoin script execution rules and transaction verification intricacies.
- Peter Todd offers further insights into Bitcoin's operational mechanics on his website.

recent_posts.title: Reiterating centralized coinjoin (Wasabi & Samourai) deanonymization attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- Yuval Kogman analyzes data from liquisabi.com on coinjoin.kruw.io's earnings since October, sourced from "floppy."- Wabisabi coordinators enforce censorship for system integrity, indirectly boosting user privacy.
- Discussion reveals coordinators' undisclosed revenue generation, urging transparency in cryptocurrency operations.

recent_posts.title: Proposal for Quantum-Resistant Address Migration Protocol (QRAMP) BIP
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal aims to protect Bitcoin from quantum threats through mandatory migration.
- It addresses the risk to all wallets, including lost ones, to preserve Bitcoin's integrity.
- Implementing this strategy now avoids catastrophic consequences and maintains user trust.

recent_posts.title: Hybrid Jamming Mitigation: Results and Updates
recent_posts.summary:
- An attacker manipulates reputation before launching a sink attack on acinq node after 90 days.
- Bi-directional reputation ensures compensation, but intermediate nodes are left uncompensated.
- Path-Length Attack Multiplier escalates damage, allowing attacks via extensive or circular routes.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Forking Guide
recent_posts.summary:
- The bcap project focuses on the importance of social consensus before Bitcoin code changes.
- The guide offers advice on achieving consensus, highlighting the need for universally beneficial changes.
- It emphasizes a detailed, cooperative approach to consensus, avoiding manipulation for community well-being.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Inquisition 28.1
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Inquisition 28.1 integrates features from Bitcoin Core 28.1, now available for download.
- New release supports TRUC, anchor relay, full replace by fee, and ephemeral dust support.
- Includes consensus changes like BIP 119, BIP 118, and BIP 347, active on default signet.

today_in_history_posts.title: Possible change to the MIT license
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin is under the MIT license, causing confusion and forks.
- The author proposes adding a line to restrict name use in forks.
- This aims to protect the ecosystem and reduce user confusion.

today_in_history_posts.title: Pizza for (lightning) bitcoins?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A man used the lightning network for a pizza trade, arranged by a friend in London.
- They agreed on a payment process involving a bolt11 invoice and a preimage confirmation.
- The trade highlighted the novelty of using lightning nodes over on-chain transactions.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive and active investment strategies differ in involvement and asset management.
- Challenges with passive investment include the principal/agent problem and potential underutilization of assets.
- The blog discusses stabilizing economies using deflationary currencies and central bank strategies.
